intro: Cephalaria dipsacoides, commonly known as the common cephalaria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have serrated edges. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, cylindrical heads, giving the plant a distinctive appearance.
